data.enText: a strong feeling in favour of or against one group of people, or one side in an argument, often not based on fair judgement

data.chText: 对新闻报道中政治偏袒的指责
data.enText: accusations of political bias in news programmes (= that reports are unfair and show favour to one political party)

data.chText: 雇主必须公平而毫无成见地考虑所有求职者。
data.enText: Employers must consider all candidates impartially and without bias.

data.chText: 有些机构仍然对妇女持有很大偏见。
data.enText: Some institutions still have a strong bias against women.
an interest in one thing more than others; a special ability
The course has a strong practical bias.
the bias of a piece of cloth is an edge cut diagonally across the threads
The skirt is cut on the bias.

data.chText: 使有偏见；使偏心；使偏向
data.enText: to unfairly influence sb's opinions or decisions

data.chText: 报章使人们对她产生了偏见。
data.enText: The newspapers have biased people against her.

ex.enText: He has a strong painting bias.
She has a bias against jazz music.

ex.chText: 你对双方应该不偏不倚。
ex.enText: You should have no bias in favour of either side.

synonyms.bx: 指对某类事物拥有天赋或兴趣；也指因个人的好恶或偏见而对某人或某物作出的不正确的、有倾向性的判断。

ex.enText: Swallows have an aptitude for building nests.
He has an aptitude for painting.

synonyms.bx: 指做某类事情的习性，侧重指非后天形成的自然本能；也指在学习方面的资质或技能，常后接介词 for。

ex.enText: He has a bent for music.
The natural bent of  my mind was to science.

synonyms.bx: 强调对某个领域有特殊的爱好，或在某方面有特长。

ex.chText: 父母通常偏爱最小的孩子。
ex.enText: Usually, parents show favour to the youngest of their children.

ex.chText: 他小心谨慎地不偏袒任何人。
ex.enText: He is careful to show favour to no one.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人或某个群体的偏袒、特别照顾。

ex.enText: She has an inclination for sports.
He has no inclination to be a teacher.

synonyms.bx: 指某人想做某事的一种意愿。

ex.enText: I have a preference for country life.
Ben has a preference of physics to/over English.

synonyms.bx: 指基于个人价值观、偏见或个人喜好程度上的选择。

ex.chText: 在美国，黑人依然要面对种族歧视问题。
ex.enText: African Americans still face racial prejudice in America.

ex.chText: 他对流行音乐怀有偏见。
ex.enText: He has a prejudice against pop music.

synonyms.bx: 尤指因种族、性别、宗教等方面的差异而形成的对特定事物不合理的否定态度。

tr: a partiality that prevents objective consideration of an issue or situation
a line or cut across a fabric that is not at right angles to a side of the fabric

example: you are biasing my choice by telling me yours

tr: slanting diagonally across the grain of a fabric

value.def: Bias is a tendency to prefer one person or thing to another, and to favour that person or thing.

example.ex: Bias against women permeates every level of the judicial system...
example.tran: 各级司法机构普遍存在对女性的偏见。

example.ex: There were fierce attacks on the BBC for alleged political bias.
example.tran: 英国广播公司因被指具有政治偏见而遭到猛烈抨击。

value.def: Bias is a concern with or interest in one thing more than others.

example.ex: The Department has a strong bias towards neuroscience.
example.tran: 这个系特别偏重神经科学。

value.def: To bias someone means to influence them in favour of a particular choice.

example.ex: We mustn't allow it to bias our teaching.
example.tran: 我们决不允许它影响我们的教学。

value.def: A dress or skirt that is cut on the bias or that is bias-cut has been cut diagonally across the material so that it hangs down in a particular way.

example.ex: The fabric, cut on the bias, hangs as light as a cobweb off a woman's body.
example.tran: 这块斜裁料如蛛网一般轻盈地从一女子身上垂下来。

trans: 偏置电流；偏流；偏压电流
选择性偏倚；选择性偏误；选择偏倚；选择偏差；选择性偏差
基底偏压；基体偏压；衬底偏置；基材偏压；衬底偏压
反向偏置；反向偏压；反偏；逆向偏压；逆偏
积极偏向；正性偏差；正偏压；正偏差
负偏压；消极偏向；负性偏向；负偏置；则为负偏差
